website_summaries.verdict: Wired headphones that sit behind your neck, making them ideal for gym wear. Extremely lightweight.
pros: Single-sided cable saves these from getting you tangled up and makes the behind-the-neck style more functional
We love that they're lightweight and comfortable, so you can wear them for long periods of time
cons: The cable is too short for some

customer_reviews.title: but like to listen to either audio books or music when ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are what I was looking for. I wear hearing aids, but like to listen to either audio books or music when out walking. I also like to wear a broad brim hat to protect my face from the Texas sun. I've tried other over the ear and bluetooth headsets, but they are heavy and cannot be worn behind the head. These headphones can be worn over my hearing aids and behind the head. They are lightweight and did not shift. They permitted me to still hear outside noises like cars and critters which ear buds do not. Old school, but still work real good!
customer_reviews.author: Rexell1951

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with these headphones
customer_reviews.text: As a person who hates earbuds, I'm in love with these headphones. I thought the neck placement of the band would be annoying, but that actually makes it easier to keep the phones around my neck during lectures/when I need to take a music break. Solid for walking. Note: I have tiny ears, and they sometimes get caught in the crevice. This is not bothersome enough to dock its rating for me.
customer_reviews.author: selam

customer_reviews.title: Hurts my ears!
customer_reviews.text: I have used behind the heck headphones to avoid the line across the top of my head for many years. This pair, unfortunately have left me wanting. There are two issues I find with these: 1) The gap between the speaker and the band is way too thin. It pinches my ear. I have never been advised of having big ears 😉. 2) There is a cable channel in the headband. It's no surprise they probably use this item on other headphones. The problem is that the edges of this channel cut into the top of my ear. I've attached a picture of these channels. Combined, these two issues make it a very unfun item to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it is more than enough
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are one of the few that are over the ear headphones that don't give me hat hair or hurt my head. They can be comfortably worn around the neck too, which is nice. If you're buying these, you aren't looking for sound quality, so I'm not even considering that. They stay on your head when you excercise, can you say that about any other over the ear headphones?
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I've Never Had a Pair Last More than a Year
customer_reviews.text: Just about to order my fourth pair of these head phones, which are more comfortable for me than painful ear buds, and don't give me headband hair. The reason I keep ordering new pairs is that after a while, one channel or the other stops working and I end up with mono headphones. Fine for listening to podcasts and other music-free content, but not so great for music. I bought my last pair in March and here it is December and I need a new pair because there is no sound coming in the right ear.
customer_reviews.author: Dogyeller

customer_reviews.title: Audio output very weak. Barely  audible
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace headphones I had to stick in my ears. Use them to listen to movie audio out of my computer. The old ones worked fine. Barely had to increase audio output to hear fine. These "NEW" Sony , MDR G45LP audio response is terrible, even w/audio turned to maximum, have trouble hearing accompanying movie sound. Was a complete waste of time and money. Going in trash. Not even worth one star. Couldn't submit without entering at least 1 star. Ken Weeks
customer_reviews.author: Ken Weeks

customer_reviews.title: How did this Sony MDR -G45LP model headphone get so expensive?
customer_reviews.text: The current price - $45.00 is outrageous. I have purchased this model in bunches for about $15.00 each for many years. Same model number and description. Nice little lightweight headset but no way worth the current price listed on Amazon. I bought them in bunches because they were cheap and tended to fall apart rather quickly. They were made in Thailand - don't know where the new lot are from - but the current price strains my imagination. I will shift to another brand - I like the behind the neck feature but would not rate this as an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Digby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for out walking!
customer_reviews.text: I will always prefer on-the-ear over earbud! These give great sound, especially if you have a lightweight winter hat on, for just that little bit of pressure really driving the nice bass into your ears. These have great, well-rounded sound, without the added danger of cancelling out traffic and the world around you. That's right, I said it; earbuds are a hazard! But these Sony's give a full-bodied sound without any one section being high or tinny or muffled. They're no studio Sony's but a fantastic buy for the price! I'll always buy street-style; Sound quality without the "what??" and pulling out a bud xD
customer_reviews.author: Aaron_MT

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not the same as they used to be. The shape is different and they dig into the tops of my ears and are terribly uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Holey-smokes these are good. WAY better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Holey-smokes these are good. WAY better than expected. Considering the price, they are a outstanding value. They sound great! I mean, literally (I guess auditory-ally). Not just great for their size and weight, just great. They're quite light-weight, very comfortable and feels very secure on my head. These sound much better than the on-the-ear lightweight headsets I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: My Absolute Favorite Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I wear headphones all day long. I mean 24 hours a day. Yes, I sleep with them. I live in a very noisy house (husband going deaf and can't hear anything unless it's turned up loud - and then he snores at night, but I digress) and I can't hear myself think unless I have my music on. And I can wear my glasses and work on my computer and the headphones don't get in the way. And these are the ones I wear 24/7. I was so disappointed when they stopped making them for a few years but now they're back and I'm stocking up.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I was watching Netflix when suddenly the sound went out in my headphones, I discovered it was the plug on the headphone cord. I did not want to pay a lot for new ones and found these Sony ones, I ordered them in the evening and they arrived the next day. I was surprised how much better the sound was than in the old ones, I just use them for the Roku , I'm hard of hearing and like after my husband goes to bed very early. Overall I'm very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B43

customer_reviews.title: Huge bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot to like about these headphones regardless of the low price. One of my likes is the fact that I can wear them without getting "headphone hair". Also, the sound is great for such an inexpensive set. I personally have not found earbuds that give me this much enjoyment. I love these for working out in the yard. I have a few pair of bluetooth behind the neck headphones, but these are my favorite even with the wire.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Sony Headphone-cradle under your neck design
customer_reviews.text: It works great!! I now have headphones where I can hear both sides of the speakers from my stereo. The headphones are unique design that cradle under your neck and you have to get use to it. Once you do, you will like it. It will take some adjusting before you see the results from it. I bought them because they were not part of the Proposition 65 warning and the earphones are the sponge kind. Therefore, this is a good product and I would suggest trying them out and avoid buying cheap headphones with the Prop 65 warning on them. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Nice, great for sports
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I haven't received the item yet, but this is my second pair. Reviewing the first pair, that finally gave up after all the abuse I've subjected it to (not it's fault at all) This is the best pair of headphones for running, period. Sony sound quality is more than acceptable for this use, and the shape of the headphones precludes them falling off of you as you run, a common problem with little earbuds or separate headphones. The behind-the-neck design is the best in terms of how firmly it's attached to your head, without causing extra sweat or inconvenience. Oh, and do get some replacement foam tops for those, they get funky quick, and they tear
customer_reviews.author: some guy

customer_reviews.title: Love Behind the Neck Style
customer_reviews.text: I hope they keep making these. Earbuds hurt my ears. These are comfortable, stay in place, and the behind the neck style doesn't have to accommodate my giant head (seriously, I have to wear mens hats in xl). This is my second pair of these. The first pair lasted years, but my kids kept swiping them and being rough. So, they also went through a lot of abuse before one of the sides went out. I'm not an expert in sound quality. My music and streaming sounds good to me. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Down with bluetooth!
customer_reviews.text: Had these for 7 years, used the hell out of them exercising and working out side in all weather. The foam cushions lasted about 3 years, but still works fine. Also, these are back to basics headsets, no volume or noise cancellation that's why the 1 star rating for these features. You want noise cancellation and volume control, just turn up volume on ipod. Old school is best!
customer_reviews.author: HMS Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Good headphone for price
customer_reviews.text: 3 days having this headphone and I got to say I like it it came in good condition no broken or anything like that and everything work fine I give 9/10 on ranting that are good means 1- sounds good guality 2- fit perfect on my head right sizes 3- there is no bass or anything like that but it sound super loud and good 4- this headphone won’t bother you while you lay down 5- pretty much this headphone is meant to use while working out or running 6- is great headphone and is cheap too you won’t regret it buying it I highly recommend getting this headphone if you planning on buying it is cheap and great :)
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Great fit with hat, relatively cheap, perfect for phone outdoors for in-ear plug haters.
customer_reviews.text: I always wear a baseball hat outdoors in spring thru summer which is where, when, I tend to wear headphones. They're inexpensive and fit very comfortably below my hat. There also relatively inexpensive which outdoor use requires. In-ear plugs which I admit are more functional, but I hate them so they aren't an option for me. And the sound is ok given I play usually compressed music on the phone player.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great freq range AND comfort!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Especially considering the price...just WOW! I have everything from Apple Ear Buds to $400 professional studio monitors! There aren't a lot of manufacturers the make this style. These have a great range for plugging into a source for busy work music! They're very comfortable! For the price, you can't beat them...especially if you don't want to mess up your hair, or your ears are in agony after only a few hours of having them in. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great because you can wear them with a bike helmet
customer_reviews.text: ive been looking to find something I could listen to podcasts on so many people where ear buds now ( that block out too much sound) that I don't like it. But with these they fit behind the helmet and are comfortable and soft. No ear Fatigue either. So I am very happy with these wrap around head sets. I am glad someone still makes them.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Love

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I was having trouble finding earbuds that would stay in and be comfortable while jogging. These headphones stay on as long as I don't look up at all. If I do, my neck bumps the back piece, which joggles the earphones. Today, while using them, my right ear started to really, really hurt. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Volume - Even with amp
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. Could not hear with these phones. In addition, packaging was totally unreal. Could not reassemble package for return. Two layers of hard, unyielding plastic - a challenge to open (knife and scissors) and impossible to repack. So stupid! Last Sony product I purchase!
customer_reviews.author: C. Patalive

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old 20+ year old model which took a dunk in a cup of coffee. I was happy these are still made. Great comfortable lightweight little headphones for the money. Unlike most headphones, which are rigid, this neck wrap is a bit flexible, so it will automatically adjust to fit, and there is no uncomfortable pressure on the ears. I forget I'm wearing them. They work will with my glasses and hearing aids. The earpiece is foam covered, and I understand they are replaceable, but , the same foam pieces lasted on my old one until it bit the dust. I use these with my laptop to watch movies or youtube.
customer_reviews.author: elaine r.

customer_reviews.title: but they are pretty cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Decent Headphones, but they are pretty cheaply made. I use mine almost every day and the foam stuff covering the ears is starting to tear. They are actually pretty comfortable, and I have a big head, so that is difficult to find in this style of headphones. I just wish they were a little better made. This is my second pair. Attached is the image of what happened to the 1st pair.
customer_reviews.author: Austin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great basic headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are always my go-to for a cheap pair of headphones to throw on a guest pc for a LAN party for my kids or to grab for a quick on the go trip. They sound pretty good for what they cost, and are lightweight and don't interfere with most people's hairstyles due to the behind the head design.
customer_reviews.author: Alan D.

customer_reviews.title: Headphones that sit at your ears
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones that don't go in your ears. The cord is on one side of the headphones which is a plus. The part that goes behind your neck moves when you move your head so then the ear pieces move with it then you have to put them back on your ears, this is the only downfall.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Decent cheap headphones
customer_reviews.text: These were comfortable, had decent sound, and overall worked just fine. They have no volume control, which is fine by me, and they don't block the ear canal, so they do not function very well to cancel noise. Unfortunately, they got stepped on. Try to avoid doing that.
customer_reviews.author: jsp

customer_reviews.title: Good Headphones
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find behind the neck headphones that aren't expensive now but these were priced very well and they are worth it. They fit well and they are perfect for use on my computer when my more expensive Bluetooth pair are being charged. There isn't much to say other than they sound good and work well, just a standard pair of Sony headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Longlasting, Lightweight, and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a pair of these from Circuit City before they went bankrupt and they didn't break. I only bought another pair because I bought Sennheisers out of curiosity and was disappointed... they had the same sound quality. Anyway, I couldn't believe these were still available and couldn't resist buying a new pair... and the quality is still there! I'm betting this pair will last another what... probably ten years if it was anything like the last pair.
customer_reviews.author: Corky

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The plastic headband is cheap and poor quality plastic, broke after 5 uses, 6 weeks after I brought it. I bought the same model 5 years ago and it still works but the new model is apparently much worse quality material.
customer_reviews.author: vadim knobel

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special but decent
customer_reviews.text: I'm probably a little spoiled because I always use my bf's headphones which are studio headphones. I needed something I could wear to do light cardio in, but I can't wear earbuds. These work fine. They stay on my head and the sound is okay. They feel weird to me, like they're going to fall off my head.. but that's probably because I'm used to heavier headphones. Many would consider the barely-there feeling a pro, I imagine. :)
customer_reviews.author: bebe

customer_reviews.title: amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: i have $500 headphones these are incredible for the price. The pads come off often. They stay on my head for working out which is why I have owned these kind for 12 years. last pair lasted like 6 before i lost them. Get extra earpads if you use them for working out.
customer_reviews.author: bennybklyn

customer_reviews.title: Long time fan
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these headphones three times in the last 9 years or so. I usually get 2-3 years of use out of them before they begin to short out. I hate ear buds, and clunky headphones. I can wear these with my hoodie or baseball cap. Very useful for urban exploration. Good balance of sound and volume too! A little stiff out of the box, but you get used to them and they loosen up a bit. I hope they never stop making this model because at ~$20 / pair they are a good bargain and investment. Much more durable them some of the higher end ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: jimmulvaney

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been through a couple pairs of these over the last few years and for the price and the beating I have put them through I am very happy with them. I mainly use them for my ipod because it isn't bluetooth. I keep a spare pair ready to go in case of an emergency. 5 Stars because I will plug these in to anything and not complain about the sound (for the price)
customer_reviews.author: washed up

customer_reviews.title: They fit well over the microphone of my hearing-aids, ...
customer_reviews.text: They fit well over the microphone of my hearing-aids, that are the over-the-ear type. Also very light for wearing for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ashley

customer_reviews.title: This over the ear style is my personal favorite and this fits expectations
customer_reviews.text: Since I do not like the ear plug style phones, these headphones fits my style of while exercising,, walking, and night time listening. Wire connection is long enough and are well made. Had the same Sony model for several years before the puppies chewed the wire. Great replacement and cheaper than the original purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Keith T

customer_reviews.title: I love to buy Sony brand but this time I am ...
customer_reviews.text: I love to buy Sony brand but this time I am not happy. I am not big on sound, as long as it is good quality then that is fine with me. So the sound quality is good enough for me for this headphone. The reason I am not happy is that the foam covers started coming off all the time. First the right and then both sides. I bought foam replacements, I hope they are better than the first pair.
customer_reviews.author: Nq

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.text: Works like I needed it to. Nothing special. I wanted a behind the head set to use with an Oculus Quest because earbuds are too unstable when you are moving around. This works better and has more pass through volume.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: I am no audiophile, but these are pretty bad.
customer_reviews.text: I am no audiophile, but these are pretty bad. I had a pair of MDR-G42's that were discontinued, but similar in price at the time. They weren't the best, but were good for music and whatnot. These looked pretty much the same, so I thought I'd try them. The sound from the G45 is terrible. Error 404 for bass. Seems like there is absolutely none. They are also very uncomfortable to wear. I know they're cheap, but had I known how bad they were I would not have gotten them. I would not recommend these for music, movies or TV. Maybe listening to the news or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR ANY ACTIVITY...
customer_reviews.text: Love it... I love that you don't have to shove it inside your ears. The plastic band that goes behind your head and on your ears is very comfortable and the cord is angled at the tip so it prevents it from braking. The quality of the product is very good. I use them at the gym, at work, around the house, while gardening, at school, and on the go and I really enjoy using them. They won't fall off or move out of place. It does not cancel noise out completely but the quality of the sound is still very good .
customer_reviews.author: Mayra Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality seems good. I just have to get used to how they fit. I previously had ones that only had a thin cord that wrapped around the back of the neck which I loved. With these I find myself adjusting them often so they fit more comfortably. Also the ear pads fall off easily which can be annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price. Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a replacement for the same brand headphones that lasted my son 2 years. He's been very happy with them despite their low end price tag. They arrived 5 days before I expected so I'm happy with that too.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Heisey

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, flexible, Sony at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Super lightweight, and so far my son hasn’t broken these! He breaks a lot of headphones, so we were happy to find Sony behind the head headphones at this price. There is a bit of flexibility in the plastic, and that’s a good thing! Hopefully, these will hold up over time...These are so lightweight that you may forget you have them on. I ordered an extra set for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Aud Reads

customer_reviews.title: Whose bright idea was it to put the seam in the plastic right where it rubs up against the top of your ears?
customer_reviews.text: Whose bright idea was it to put the seam in the plastic right where it rubs up against the top of your ears? These just aren't very comfortable. The sound is good the shape is great but it feels like it's going to Cut my ears off whenever I put them on. I should've returned them already but I waited too long too late to return them now...
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great for the gym!
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for the gym! I can't vouch for the sound quality of these headphones because I don't use them for anything other than listening to TV programs through my gym's cardio equipment. That's the use for which I bought them and they work perfectly. What more can I say?
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W.

customer_reviews.title: Love These Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I used to be able to find these behing-the-head headphones in a drug store but not anymore. These Sony G45's are great and inexpensive. Most headphones give you 20-20,000 hz in frequency but these go 16-20,000 hz. That little extra low end gives just the right amount of extra bass sound. Glad to see they are still available.
customer_reviews.author: Thom MG

customer_reviews.title: Kidda small for adults
customer_reviews.text: I got these to work with My Oculus Rift S after watching a YouTube video on them. When I got them they seemed nice and not poorly built but they are definitely too small for my head and did not cover my ear enough to use.
customer_reviews.author: W. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Sony Headphones superior quality for low price
customer_reviews.text: The Sony headphones are the second set I have purchased. The 1st set wore out from constant wear and tear. the number one reason I like the earphones is that they sit on my ears and not inside. They are not large and bulky and don't cover the whole ear.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Dandy Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to headphones for 10+ years. I wear them in bed listening to music as I drift off to slumber-land. I add an extra foam pad on the earpieces so I can lie on my side wth them on comfortably. I have another pair in the kitchen that I wear walking the dogs on winter evenings. The sound is goid and my ears stay warm. Only reason I have to buy new ones is because I sonetimes lose them when I take them on trips. Overall, for the price and sound quality, these are just dandy, if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy the G

customer_reviews.title: Simple, good quality, decent comfort
customer_reviews.text: I wanted some corded headphones for the office that don't completely isolate me and these work well. They are not the most comfortable but it takes 3-5 hours before it hurts a little. Still great!
customer_reviews.author: Bert T.

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Audiophiles may find something wrong with this headset, but for me the sound quality is fine. Rock music of various styles all sound crisp and clear. However, the cheap plastic of the band does tend to pinch on the ears if worn for prolonged periods. If you just use them for a 15 minute jog, you should be fine. However, working overnight listening to music for hours the discomfort becomes apparent rather soon. Wrapping a strip of duct tape around the band by the ears will save you some pain, if you don't mind how cheap it will make them look. If you want a long-wearing solution I'd suggest elsewhere. Short-term they'll do the job though.
customer_reviews.author: DrowNoble

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Nice for the price. I wish they fit a little snugger. I think I have an average sized head and the fit feels loose. Otherwise, I would have given five stars. Update: I now know how to correctly wear these by tucking them in off the top of my ears. Lol, my bad! Changing 4 stars to 5.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones for working out (I've been using them ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones for working out (I've been using them about 7 years now and have never had to replace them) so I bought some for my husband as well, since he was having trouble with other headphones shorting out on him when he got sweaty on runs. He was not a believer that these would work, but they have had no issues whatsoever, and he is a sweaty-headed runner! Highly recommend to anyone using them for sports. I have trouble keeping in-ear headphones in my ears, which is why I bought these.
customer_reviews.author: Hope_ut

customer_reviews.title: decent workout headphones if on sale
customer_reviews.text: These last me about a year of daily use, before the wiring takes too much punishment and a speaker cuts out. This is likely from the cable being tugged/yanked a few times too many. I wanted some headphones that i could kick around though, so I can't fault the manufacturer for my abuse. The cord is the standard workout-length 3ft. The neck band is hard plastic, so they tend to get uncomfortable after 1-2 hours of use. They are decent in the $10-15 price range. At $20 I would look for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Bam Bam

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound, weird fitt
customer_reviews.text: I use these pretty regularly, I hate ear buds and these sound pretty good but they are pretty large around the back of the skull ( and I don't have a particularly small head) and so they kind of hang behind your head a pick up some vibration rattle when jogging., not terrible, but a bit of an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: heidrich lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones - buy while you can ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. I'm glad they're still available on-line (Best Buy no longer carries them, evidently due to consumer-related complaints re skin contact with the plastic, resulting in irritation). These headphones are inexpensive, comfortable, and very durable. Music sounds great whether using them on an i-Phone or a Sony "Walkman". The plastic is strong yet flexible, and very difficult to warp or break. The Foam Pad Ear Covers will begin disintegrating after six months of daily use, so plan on purchasing replacement pads for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Bard

customer_reviews.title: Sound Good, Hurt My Ears
customer_reviews.text: For years, the Sony MDR-G45LP Street Style Neckband Headphones were my go-to headphones. They were cheap, durable, and best of all, they sounded great. They would normally last me about 6 months before the headphone jack would rip off, and about a month later the sound in one side would eventually go out. For me, 6 months is a long time for headphones. These headphones were, however, extremely painful on my ears. I had to remove them after a while because they would hurt really badly and I had to rub my ears. These are no longer my headphones of choice, I have moved onto to the most popular pair of headphones by Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Dirtt Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Sound is excellent but the ear pieces are too small and should ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound is excellent but the ear pieces are too small and should be sold with replacement covers because they are very flimsy and any significantsweat from working out or running will deteriorate the ear piece cushion covers......too bad because they are as advertised very light but in reality the weight is of no consequence anyway; the sound and the comfort of a FULL size earpiece should be the predominate feature.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Headphones for Winter!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best behind the ear headphones you can get at this price! I already had a pair that was wearing out. They are perfect for wearing in the winter because they keep my ears warm, especially for taking long walks! And, they do not hurt my sensitive ears. There is no deep bass on some songs, but deep enough for me. When it comes to earbuds, which are annoying most of the time, you have to push them deep into the ear to get that deep bass. I gave 4 stars for the cheap plastic and foam ear covering.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Starks

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I currently used a standard pair of headphones at work. But, because I didn't want to mess up my hair, I'd put the headband behind my head. So, I bought this pair and I can tell you.. they're SUPER comfortable. They're lightweight and have excellent sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: CRISIS

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice headphone that replaces an older worn out similar pair. I think the sound is even better in this new one. I know it does not compare to very expensive ones, but these are perfect for me...good treble, mid range and bass. They fit neatly on my head which is rather small. I think they may be tight, at least at first, for a large person. I have not had them long enough to tell if they stretch in size with use. They are great for using on a tread mill or for running etc.
customer_reviews.author: Creative 1

customer_reviews.title: Best. Headphones. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: These are the only headphones I use! I can't stand ear buds being inside my ears, and this is the perfect design for me. Lightweight and with good sound. Not the most powerful headphones (they are not noise cancelling) but perfect for everyday use or working out.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Don't Fit Large Heads
customer_reviews.text: These headphones don't fit large heads very well. Every time I move or tilt my head, the band pulls at the back of my neck and the speakers get pulled back across my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Won’t fall off when sweating
customer_reviews.text: These are great for working out (running) bc won’t fall off ears when sweating, like ear buds. Only last about 8 months if used daily; not too expensive so that’s ok.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for anyone with a big head! Includes me as well
customer_reviews.text: I had these headphones before but I love them and they have a good life span on them if you dont get it wet. Highly recommend for those that don't like over the head head phones
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great quality of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these head phones. I have bought several. They are so good that I keep several available for travel as well as listening at home. They fit snug around my neck. One weakness seems to be the wire will short out and quit working.
customer_reviews.author: James Connor

customer_reviews.title: I love the way they fit around the back of my ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the only headphones I will buy, I love the way they fit around the back of my neck and not on top of my head. I hate earbuds,these are perfect for me. They have awesome sound, not completely noise cancelled, but I like being aware of things going on around me...the sound is great, and they don't mess up my hair. My son tried mine, so had to get him a pair too...very light-weight, and the bass is great. Mine have lasted me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: redvayne

customer_reviews.title: Sound is outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Just tried the headphones and the sound is amazing. I have listened to headphones much more pricey with the sound not as good as this one. My wife liked them too so I will order another for her. Looking forward to many hours of listening on these. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I do like these Sony MDR-G45LP headphones a lot. They are super comfortable, light weight, offer good sound, and most important, stay in place when I'm walking. For me, the fit is just right. However, when compared to the Philips Rich Bass Neckband Headphones SHS5200/28 (also sold on Amazon), the Sony's sound isn't quite as robust. The downfall with the Philips are they are a little bulky, and don't stay on my ears as well as the Sonys. So, for sitting at my desk, I prefer the Philips. For walking, the Sony wins. Both are great buys for the money.
customer_reviews.author: midwest mom

customer_reviews.title: Rough seam on band
customer_reviews.text: There is a seam on the neckband for the wire and it has sharp edges. After a while it feels very rough on the top of your ears. They should have put it on the top of the band so the smooth side would rest on your ears instead.
customer_reviews.author: P-Dub

customer_reviews.title: My favorite wired headphones. Solid but tight (the tightness costs them a star).
customer_reviews.text: Love these kinds of headphones and I HATE that they can only be found in online stores these days. I'm always worried that the next set I buy will be the last available. I wish they would make wireless versions exactly like these (Sony USED to). Anyway, I'm wearing a pair right now; and, while they COULD be more comfortable while sitting writing online reviews (they're kind of tight), there is NO headphone set I've ever had that I like better for running or working out--I just wish they were wireless.
customer_reviews.author: ShaunM

customer_reviews.title: Good pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: The only headphones that seem to last! My spouse swears by these headphones. Over the ear and behind the neck allows for more comfort as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Poteet

customer_reviews.title: It's the fidelity
customer_reviews.text: A replacement for the pair I wore out (listening to tunes on my bicycle, about 8 hours/wk). These do not interfere with my glasses or helmet. They're terrific.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Loud and clear
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked these headphones because they are light weight, don't fall/pop out of your ears, and they don't tangle up. Good travel companion and works with my phone, laptop, and Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: anthonykhreig_2000

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive corded headphones.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite headphones. Very good sound, comfortable for extended wear. The back of the neck style means they don't slip out of place. They are a little sweatier if you use them during brisk exercise. I don't know how many times I've jerked the cables by mistake on my previous pairs and they still last for several years. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BillH

customer_reviews.title: The best of the lot
customer_reviews.text: I am a repeat purchaser. I buy more because I have worn out or destroyed my current pair. Tried others, but can't beat these for bang for the buck. Thery're not Cadillac or even noise-cancelling, but for the money, they can't be beat. I especially like that they fit so comfortably that I can wear them while lying on a pillow...in any position. Many times I'll wake up, realize music has ended, drop them on the floor next to the bed, and then go back to sleep. (Although there have been mornings where I'll wake up and realize I had them on all night.) If anybody ever perfects a 'sleep learning' system, these will be the headphones you'll wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P

customer_reviews.title: I Bought this for my Oculus Rift S VR and I'm satisified.
customer_reviews.text: These are alright for replacement headphones on your Oculus Rift S. The sound quality is an improvement over ear buds, so I'm happy for the price. There could be a better option though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, comfortable, and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: They were considered high-quality headphones before the irrationally priced Dr Dre Beats. I haven't worn any of the $100+ pairs of late, and don't have a need to with these. I used these at the gym and working around the house. My first pair lasted for years of sweating (cat killed them). I now prefer wireless, but my wife uses these at the gym. Comfortable wearing up to 3-4 hrs, then irritation behind the ears. Good for bench pressing but not lying on a pillow. Bonus star for value.
customer_reviews.author: TRx

customer_reviews.title: Never a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I can't recall where I purchased my first pair of these headphones, but I just got my second pair in the mail. These are simplistic, sexy, and functional. There's no doubt about it. They fit perfectly, they have great sound quality, and they last more than people suggest. Yeah, they feel flimsy at times, but nothing that bad, and they're more durable than you might think. Always pleased with these. :) For the record, the reason for having bought a second pair is because the right side of the headphones on my first pair was no longer working. Which is to be expected considering how long I'd been using them. Nothing to complain about, especially at the price. :)
customer_reviews.author: Alban

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for background music at work.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little headphones for my work cubicle. The behind-head style lets the rail sit right behind my ears so they don't slide around or muss my 'do. They're not noise-cancelling or anything, but that's fine; I need to be able to hear when my phone rings anyway.
customer_reviews.author: ElLoboGordoTop Contributor: Poker

customer_reviews.title: ... four years my wife has been looking for the perfect headphones to use while she exercises at the gym
customer_reviews.text: For the past four years my wife has been looking for the perfect headphones to use while she exercises at the gym, and I mean three/four days every week. She bought these on the recommendation of a fellow gym member and the search is over! They are lightweight, have a single cord, and sound great. Because they go behind the neck rather than over the head they are more comfortable and reduce sweating. She loves them!
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Mclellan, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: looks better that advertised
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I've had several of these headphones I will buy more best phones made for the price delivers true sound not amplified artificial bass great for editing sound
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone B.

customer_reviews.title: Not Clear Enough or Loud Enough for Jogging
customer_reviews.text: I got these for jogging but ended up not using them for that because my music wasn't loud enough or clear enough for me. And I wasn't expecting them to sound perfect or anything... If you like your music pretty decently loud and clear, these might not be for you. I ended up getting the adidas sport in-ear neckband ones instead, which were also pretty reasonably priced but gave more clear and a little louder sound, again not perfect sound, but a lot better than these. Now my son uses these when he's playing video games I don't want to hear, so at least we found a use for them!
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite headphones. I've had several pairs. Mostly due to my roughness! I have several ear piercings which do not allow for certain types of headphones and these are the most comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Evans

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit. Far too tight on the head
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could return these.Not sure why I can't. Bad fit. Far too tight on the head. Sound quality isn't very good either. Waste of money. Donating to good will.
customer_reviews.author: Severian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed headphones to use while working that allow for outside sound to get through (non-noise cancelling) that also did not sit on top of my head. These are perfect. Lightweight, stay in place on my ears and allow surrounding sounds in so I don't have to remove them for co-workers to have a conversation with me. Also the foam ear pieces allow air circulation so my ears don't get hot.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Butler

customer_reviews.title: These are Great
customer_reviews.text: Headphones that are wired and are around the neck are getting hard to find. The only thing that would make these better is if you could get then with an inline MIC with volume and pause/play button.
customer_reviews.author: Wilkes W

customer_reviews.title: They are cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap but nothing close in sound quality that my phillips had. Volume at max is hard to hear if there is any background noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adequate and worth the money for limited use.
customer_reviews.text: Convenient behind the ear headphones but the sound is rather shallow, low end depth is lacking. Worth the price but if you want a full sound quality, buy an upscale headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Aweful head phones!
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst headphones I’ve ever had! I must say they did replace them but these just stopped working Again!!! Very very disappointed especially since I’m still on the bike doing cardio!!! Don’t buy them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Huegel

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite headphones to use while riding my bike
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite headphones to use while riding my bike. We live in California and the law is you can't wear headphones while riding a bike. These are great as I can leave them around my neck and still hear my Mp3. They are made very well and are becoming harder to find.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn N

customer_reviews.title: Preferred by my teenage son
customer_reviews.text: After several years of daily use, my son's other pair just like this broke. We tried an over the head style, but they squeezed his ears and weren't as comfortable, possibly because he wears glasses. So, back to the Sony headphones we go. We had to replace the foam ear covers on the last ones, but these are a great price & if this pair lasts even close to as long as the last pair did, I'll be more than satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: jsunshines

customer_reviews.title: Becoming more comfortable over time.
customer_reviews.text: This was a good replacement for the old Sony MDR-G45LP that eventually died on my after years of use. I have a fairly large head, so these felt tight on me at first, but I think they're slowly stretching out over time. At this point, I really don't notice any tightness. I like this style of headphone because they're more comfortable than having buds in my ears, and they give me a bit more ability to hear when someone approaches than the large over ear headphones would. I think they're ideal for casual use with my PC while sitting in my office at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this model of headphone for about 7 years now. They're lightweight, comfortable, and produce great sound for lower-end headphones. I am really rough on my headphones, and they usually last me a year and a half--an absolute miracle considering the abuse I put them through. I hope Sony never stops making these!
customer_reviews.author: Firebird

customer_reviews.title: These work great! I love them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because headphones move around my head. These stay in place. I can wear them when i go to sleep at a friends house where I didn't have my laptop and Internet radio. The cord is long enough that I put my MP3 player on the nightstand and I could turn over in my sleep. I bought these as a 2nd set or back up for the set I already had because after 4 years, I tore the pads. Both sets work great. This is an inexpensive headset and works great! I recommend them and would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Steinbach

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best set of headphones I have ever purchased. I have had the same pair for over three years now and have never had an issue with them not working. The pair I had previously - the same pair, lasted almost five years and only had to be replaced because of an error of my own (the cord was cut in half) otherwise I think I would still have that same pair. Five stars because I have yet to find a better headset at this price for the amazing quality that comes with it
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: slight bit of Inaccurate information
customer_reviews.text: The part on the website that says "1 Lithium ion batteries required" is NOT True. Otherwise this is a good product. It is the same as the one sold on the Amazon page  (I purchased one of each and received the same thing).
customer_reviews.author: Gerald E. Ottenbreit

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Just got these as throw-away headphones and I'm surprised at how good the sound is. Now to see how long they last...
customer_reviews.author: Alsand

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfortable Product
customer_reviews.text: I had headphones just like these and they finally wore out after many years of use. These were the exact replacement and work exactly how I want them to. And are so comfortable since they are not on top of my head but in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

product_meta.title: Sony MDR-G45LP (Black)
product_meta.description: Features: Single-sided cord for outdoor use Comfort and Sleek Style Lightweight design for the active listener Behind-the-neck headband Stereo mini plug 1.2m (3.9 ft.) cord
feature_bullets: Single sided cord which is suitable for outdoor usage
Lightweight for comfort over long time listening
Single-Sided Cord Suitable For Outdoor Usage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,662 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
